message.content:
{"id": "124610", "title": "Bug 124610 - Add a filter on a boolean computed column will cause error.", 
"description": "", 
"OB": "Add a filter on a boolean computed column should not cause an error.", 
"EB": "When adding a filter on a boolean computed column and saving and previewing, an error occurs.",
"SR": "Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new BIRT sample data source and a dataset from the table 'orders'.
2. Create a computed column with the name 'yes/no', type 'any' (not boolean), and value 'if(row[1]%2==0){true;}else{false;}'.
3. Drag the dataset from the Data Explorer to the Layout.
4. Select the table and click on the 'Filters' tab in the Property Editor.
5. Click the 'Add' button.
6. Select 'yes/no' as the Expression and 'Is True' as the Operator.
7. Save and preview the report.

Expected result: The filter should work without causing any error.
Actual result: An error occurs: 'data.engine.ConvertToDataTypeError org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: Cannot convert the value to class java.lang.Boolean.'"}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>

', 'SR': 'Description:Add a filter on a boolean computed column will cause error.Steps to reproduce:1. New a BIRT sample data source and a dataset from table "orders"2. Create a computed column with name="yes/no", type = any(no boolean for choose),value=if(row[1]%2==0){true;}else{false;}3. Drag the dataset from Data Explorer to Layout4. Select the table, click Filters tab in Property Editor.5. Click Add button.6. Select yes/no as Expression, Is True as Operator.7. '}
